alert.note: Alert for Accomack (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 8:47PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Accomack County through 930 PM EDT... At 847 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles south of Lawsonia, or 20 miles southwest of Pocomoke City, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Onancock, Parksley, Onley, Accomac, Melfa, Bloxom, Saxis, Hallwood, Mappsville, Wallops Island, Temperanceville, Nelsonia, Locustville, Sanford, Modest Town, Clam, Guilford, Assawoman and Tasley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
